intro: Astartea aspera, commonly known as the rough astartea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a rough, textured surface. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Astartea aspera is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its fibrous roots and robust stems make it adaptable to a variety of soil types.
